agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, housing issues, and public benefits. Preference is given to legal problems that prevent clients from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted.
site_details: Call during service hours or complete online application. Be prepared to answer questions about household income and assets.
site_eligibility: Income 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- With a civil legal issue that does not generate fees

agency_name: BUREAU OF CHILD DEVELOPMENT SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A government agency assuring Indiana families with infants and toddlers experiencing developmental delays or disabilities have access to early intervention services close to home when they need them through a coordinated system of local inter-agency councils called First Steps.
site_name: FIRST STEPS OF SOUTHERN INDIANA - CLUSTER I
service_description: Serves as an entry point for infants and toddlers who have or are at risk for developmental delays. Services include home-based special instruction; occupational, physical, and speech therapy; access to health and social services; and case management.
taxonomy_name: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
nameLevel3: Early Intervention for Children With Disabilities/Delays
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Clark, Crawford, Dubois, Floyd, Gibson, Harrison, Orange, Perry, Pike, Posey, Scott, Spencer, Vanderburgh, Warrick or Washington County -- Ages 0-3  -- With, or at risk for, developmental delays

service_name: RESTORING FAMILY LINKS - MISSING PERSONS ASSISTANCE
service_description: Assists people in making contact and communication with loved ones separated by war, natural disaster, and civil disturbances. Also works with family members to learn the fate of persons missing as a result of the Holocaust.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Families separated as a result of either armed conflict or disaster -- Normal channels of communication have been exhausted -- Person making the inquiry can provide essential information on the sought person -- Person making the inquiry is a close family relative who has been in direct contact with the sought person before the conflict or disaster occurred (Exceptions to the above may be made in the case of Holocaust inquiries.)

agency_desc: County organization responsible for filing, recording, and entering orders from the Countys Court system pertaining to civil, juvenile and criminal matters; issuing letters of administration, letters of guardianship, recording wills, inventories of estates, sale bills, final accounts and reports distribution in probate proceedings; serving as the Voter Registration officer for the county and receive candidate and election filings as applicable under state law. service_description: Oversees the administration of all county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance in Floyd County. This office also serves as a voter registration site and provides information about candidates, voting times and locations, absentee voting, and working the polls.

site_eligibility: To register to vote in Floyd County: United States citizens -- Living in Floyd County -- At least 18 years old on the day of the next election -- Not currently imprisoned after being convicted of a crime -- To vote in Floyd County: Registered in current precinct at least 29 days before the election

service_description: Issues marriage licenses, provides certified copies of marriage licenses, and maintains records of marriage licenses issued in ___ County. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: For marriage license: Both parties at least 18 years old (call for exceptions) -- At least one a Floyd County resident, or both from out of state -- For certified copies of a marriage license: License must have been issued in Floyd County

agency_name: NEW ALBANY TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - FLOYD COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: NEW ALBANY TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - FLOYD COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: FLOYD COUNTY LIBRARY - NEW ALBANY CENTRAL
service_description: Provides an array of library services including borrowing books, periodicals, media items for adults, teens and children, reference books and databases, inter-library loan service, programming for all ages, "Walking Books" programs for the homebound, and Indiana History Room with genealogical capabilities. Also offers internet access and computer workstations with printer, WiFi, and laptops for use in the Library. In addition, provides computer classes and assistance with job search.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information. www.floydlibrary.org
site_eligibility: Floyd County residents or property owners and reciprocal borrowers from Clark and Harrison counties. Parents or legal guardians must sign the application for children under the age of 16 and also show an approved form of identification.

Also offers internet access and computer workstations with printer, WiFi, and laptops for use in the Library. In addition, provides computer classes and assistance with job search.
site_details: Call or visit the website to schedule curbside pickup.
site_eligibility: Floyd County residents or property owners and reciprocal borrowers from Clark and Harrison counties. Parents or legal guardians must sign the application for children under the age of 16 and also show an approved form of identification.

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction materials to patrons of all ages.

site_details: Call or visit the website to schedule curbside pickup.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Emergency shelter -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter. Emergency shelter
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY CLARK AND FLOYD INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Clark and Floyd County.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY CLARK AND FLOYD INDIANA
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low income persons in Clark and Floyd County.  Participants contribute a set number of labor hours ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan.
site_details: Call for information
site_eligibility: Must meet income guidelines and pass application screening process.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Floyd County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Floyd County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, walk in to pick up an application or call the prosecutor's office for information. -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Floyd County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to crime victims and witnesses in Floyd County. Assists in the filing of restraining or protective orders, offers court accompaniment services, and provides information about case status, victim compensation, victim rights, and the legal process.

site_eligibility: Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Floyd County
